metadata.name: File And SubFolder Enumeration Via Dir Command
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the "dir" command part of Widows CMD with the "/S" command line flag in order to enumerate files in a specified directory and all subdirectories.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('cmd.exe') AND (lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*dir.*-s.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*dir.*/s.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*dir.*–s.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*dir.*—s.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*dir.*―s.*'))

output.summary: Detects usage of the "dir" command part of Widows CMD with the "/S" command line flag in order to enumerate files in a specified directory and all subdirectories.
